profile_data.summary:
I've always been an avid gamer, and I love creating videogames just as much as I enjoy playing them. Over the years, I've developed games with wildly different themes, ranging from birds jumping to avoid electric shocks on a telephone wire, to an ice cream lady who uses ice cream to defeat lactose intolerant monsters.

Feel free to reach out to me - especially if you want to talk about game design, graphic design, or iOS development! You can play my games and learn more about me at jrcabansag.com
profile_data.headline: Software Engineering Intern at Riot Games

experience.description:
Formulated a solution for an unsolved UX challenge in the Pinterest iOS app - then implemented it in a generic class so it could easily be used by others. My solution is currently being used in major surfaces visited by millions of pinners daily (being used in the profile surface, and soon the board surface)

Created a personalized and focused shopping surface for pinners, allowing them to shop more efficiently

Jumpstarted a flow to help users with party planning, one of the biggest use cases for Pinterest

Conducted UX research and utilized user feedback to address design flaws and improve the pinner experience for the board surface

Coded with Objective C
experience.title: iOS Development Intern

experience.description:
Developed Ice Scream, an action/puzzle game where you use ice cream to defeat evil, lactose intolerant monsters

Won 1st place in the Stanford CS248 Video Game Competition, with judges from Blizzard, Riot, and PocketGems

Designed/programmed game features that reward players for strategic and exciting gameplay

Created all game assets, characters, and animations (including five different enemy monsters) using Blender

Added character customization for an added level of fun. This also makes the game replayable, as it encourages players to shoot for new high scores (as cosmetics are unlocked once players achieve a certain score in levels)

Made the game on my own in a span of 10 weeks, using Unity3D, Blender, and C#
experience.title: Ice Scream Creator

experience.description:
Made Penguin Tag, a competitive game where penguins have a snowball fight and play tag simultaneously

Utilized deep learning to create an opponent AI that plays like an experienced player, by training a fully connected network with two hours of my own gameplay

Applied concepts learned from neural network class, such as data augmentation, batch gradient descent, and overfitting/underfitting recognition to iterate upon and improve my model

Trained model using Tensorflow, coded game in Javascript (and imported trained model using Deeplearn.js) and designed pixelated graphics in MS Paint

Play Penguin Tag at jrcabansag.com/PenguinTagAI

Read my research paper about my neural network model at bit.ly/penguintagresearchpaper
experience.title: Penguin Tag Creator

experience.description:
Developed Quiz4, an online multiplayer game where players play Connect4 with a twist - you can only take a turn if you're the first to answer a question correctly

Used socket.io to allow for online, real-time games between multiple players

Added support for player teams for extra competitiveness and fun

 Created minimalist graphics using HTML5 elements and React, and coded game logic using Node.js and Javascript

Play Quiz4 at quiz4jr.herokuapp.com
experience.title: Quiz4 Creator

education.description:
Head of CS+Social Good Design & Marketing:
• Manage publicity for a national movement that is rapidly growing (with chapters in Brown University and Georgia Tech)
• Strive for improvement by constantly communicating with members and incorporating their criticism/feedback into my work
• Create posters, booklets, stickers, and more using Sketch
• Compose newsletter to be sent to entire campus

Classes:
CS248: Interactive Computer Graphics (Unity3D, Blender, C#)
CS230: Deep Learning (Tensorflow)
CS109: Introduction to Probability for Computer Scientists (Probability, Proofs)
CS124: From Languages to Information (NLP, Python)
CS145: Introduction to Databases (SQLite3)
CS131: Computer Vision: Foundations and Applications (Python)
CS103: Mathematical Foundations of Computing (Proofs)
CS157: Logic and Automated Reasoning (Proofs)
CS107: Computer Organization and Systems (C)
CS106X/106L: Programming Abstractions Accelerated (C++)
education.activities: Head of CS+Social Good Design & Marketing, Lantana Design Student, Pilipino American Student Union Community Service Intern, Branner Service Scholar

education.activities: Computer Systems Lab Research, President of Codi's Hats, Japanese National Honor Society
education.description:
Computer Systems Lab Research:
- Developed windows software allowing the user to control their computer using only their eyes, providing a more accessible and sanitary alternative to the computer mouse
- Completed project early and explored further applications by creating a webpage allowing users to upload pictures for customizable eyetracking experiments
- Coded with C++ in Visual Studio
- Implemented WinAPI with Tobii EyeX eyetracker SDK

Classes:
Computer Systems Research (C++) 
Parallel Computing I & II (C)
Artificial Intelligence I & II (Python)
Web App Development (Javascript)
Mobile App Development (Java)
APCS & Foundations of CS (Java)
education.schoolName: Thomas Jefferson High School for Science and Technology

honors.description:
Created MoonLens, a VR platform that provides virtual reality inexpensively. I worked on the mobile app and used Swift and the iPhone's gyroscope feature to create a VR app from scratch.

Check out the project at: https://devpost.com/software/moonlens
honors.title: Best VR App

honors.description:
Created Zomblr - a fitness social network where your followers are zombies, so when they run you have to run too!

Check out the project here: https://devpost.com/software/zomblr
honors.title: Best Designed Mobile App

honors.description:
Created a social network that builds a community for people suffering with PTSD, implementing a notification system that allows users to save others' posts (and thus never missing them) when they reach a certain threshold.

Check out an article about my project here (near the bottom): http://tjpartnershipfund.org/2015/10/tj-students-are-computing-wizards/
honors.title: Best Overall App
Best Biochemistry Student
